review_title: ASPH is a great place to work

pros: Flexible working available. Supportive manager. Good leave.

job_title: Clinical Office Coordinator in Chertsey, England
pros: Working on bank you are able to choose the days you don't want to work fairly easily.
cons: Middle management were useless (when they were even there) and were constantly changing so any issues that were raised were offloaded to the next in line and subsequently forgotten about or dealt with poorly since the new manager would have no knowledge of the situation. Several periods where there was no manager for my department.

pros: Amazing Team I loved working in Maternity
cons: no pay rise which is a shame

pros: Best Teamwork, compassionate, caring and loving Department
cons: None or nothing to mention

job_title: Assistant Director of Operations in London, England
pros: Friendly, Flexible, Professional, Personable and Caring
cons: Location and salaries make it harder to recruit to.

pros: Great team members and I thought that management and senior colleagues were approachable and understanding. I also felt that my development was encouraged and supported. I have made life long friends working here!
cons: Mandatory training was awkward to view and update (especially as someone who's role was both clinical and clerical). The trust uses lots of different IT systems which were not integrated or linked making them quite inefficient. Remote working wasn't easy as a lot of the IT systems were not accessible from home and the VPN often disconnected you during peak usage.

pros: nice enviroment to work in
cons: not enough career progression imo

review_title: Amazing place to work! Come and join us!
job_title: Senior Healthcare Assistant in Chertsey, England
pros: I work alongside some of the most amazing people in the trust. Helping to provide an excellent service to the public and provide tailor made and efficient care to some of most vulnerable people in our society. As I work in a busy department our sense of teamwork is beyond words and this shows in the regular patient feedback we get from the NHS Choices website and the friends and family test results!
cons: It can be very stressful especially when patients and relatives complain and we don't always have the time to provide the care we would like all our patients to receive!

pros:

cons:

Not alot of training opportunities
